name: go-coding-standards
description: Professional Go coding standards for Augment Code AI covering web services, microservices, CLI tools, cloud-native applications, distributed systems, DevOps tooling, and API development
author: MyTech Today

categories.name: Web Services
categories.description: HTTP server development, middleware patterns, request/response handling, routing (net/http, gorilla/mux, chi), graceful shutdown, TLS configuration

categories.name: Microservices
categories.description: Service discovery, health checks, circuit breakers, distributed tracing (OpenTelemetry), metrics (Prometheus), gRPC communication, service mesh integration

categories.name: CLI Tools
categories.description: Command-line parsing (cobra, urfave/cli), flag handling, configuration management (viper), output formatting, exit codes, cross-platform compatibility

categories.name: Cloud-Native Applications
categories.description: Containerization (Docker), Kubernetes operators, cloud provider SDKs (AWS, GCP, Azure), 12-factor app principles, environment-based configuration

categories.name: Distributed Systems
categories.description: Consensus algorithms, event sourcing, CQRS patterns, message queues (NATS, Kafka, RabbitMQ), distributed locks, eventual consistency

categories.name: DevOps Tooling
categories.description: Infrastructure automation, CI/CD pipelines, configuration management, monitoring agents, log aggregation, GitOps workflows

categories.name: API Development
categories.description: RESTful API design, GraphQL servers, API versioning, authentication/authorization (JWT, OAuth2), rate limiting, OpenAPI/Swagger documentation

options.categories: Array of category IDs to enable (web, microservices, cli, cloud, distributed, devops, api)
